title: gg_hist_qq_boot_and_gg_scatter_boot
text: vignette demonstrates two ggplot2-based utilities visualizing bootstrap estimates stored/returned semboottools: gg_hist_qq_boot(): modular histogram/density optional CI, mean/boot-mean lines, SD arrow, side--side QQ plot. gg_scatter_boot(): scatterplot matrix (via GGally) multiple parameters’ bootstrap draws. Compared base plots, functions modern (ggplot2) modular (optional layers), can return ggplot objects customization. Dependencies: Requires ggplot2 (GGally scatterplot matrix). Optional: patchwork arrange histogram QQ plots side--side.

title: gg_hist_qq_boot_and_gg_scatter_boot
code: library(lavaan)  # Simulate data set.seed(1234) n <- 200 x <- runif(n) - 0.5 m <- 0.4 * x + rnorm(n) y <- 0.3 * m + rnorm(n) dat <- data.frame(x, m, y)  # Specify model model <- '   m ~ a * x   y ~ b * m + cp * x   ab := a * b '  # Fit model fit0 <- sem(model, data = dat, fixed.x = FALSE)  # Store bootstrap draws fit2 <- store_boot(   fit0,   R = 5000,   iseed = 2345)

title: gg_hist_qq_boot_and_gg_scatter_boot
code: gg_hist_qq_boot(fit2, param = "ab", standardized = FALSE) #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`). gg_scatter_boot(fit2, c("ab", "a", "b"), standardized = FALSE) #> Warning in ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = #> ggplot2::after_stat(density)), : Ignoring unknown parameters: `size` #> Warning in ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(density)), : Ignoring unknown parameters: `size` #> Ignoring unknown parameters: `size` gg_hist_qq_boot(fit2, param = "ab", standardized = TRUE) #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`). gg_scatter_boot(fit2, c("ab", "a", "b"), standardized = TRUE) #> Warning in ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = #> ggplot2::after_stat(density)), : Ignoring unknown parameters: `size` #> Warning in ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(density)), : Ignoring unknown parameters: `size` #> Ignoring unknown parameters: `size`

title: jab_after_boot
text: vignette demonstrates use jab_after_boot() compute Jackknife--Bootstrap (JAB) influence values single model parameter lavaan fit stored bootstrap replicates (includingboot.idx). function summarizes full bootstrap distribution leave-one-(LOO) subdistributions, ranks influential observations, (optionally) plots diagnostic figure.
code: library(semboottools) library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-19 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.

title: jab_after_boot
text: function jab_after_boot() accepts following arguments:

title: jab_after_boot
text: function returns list following components:

title: jab_after_boot
text: run jab_after_boot() verbose = TRUE, two blocks output shown: Full-sample bootstrap summary () block reports overall bootstrap distribution chosen parameter across bootstrap replicates. includes bootstrap mean, standard error (SE), percentile confidence interval. values consistent obtain standardizedSolution_boot() parameterEstimates_boot() without JAB. words, reference point leave-one-results compared. Leave-one-(LOO) summaries block lists top top_k influential cases, ranked absolute JAB influence statistic. case, shows: JAB_value: influence index Ij=n(θ‾(−j)−θ‾) I_j = n \big( \bar{\theta}_{(-j)} - \bar{\theta} \big)  Large positive values mean excluding case increases bootstrap mean; large negative values mean decreases bootstrap mean. mean, SE, CI.Lo, CI.: bootstrap mean, standard error, confidence interval recomputed case excluded resampling. comparing numbers full-sample summary, can diagnose individual observations exert strongest influence bootstrap results. diagnostic plot visualizes information: Black points: leave-one-bootstrap means observation. Blue points: influential cases (top top_k absolute JAB value). Horizontal line: full-sample bootstrap mean, serving reference. case highly influential, corresponding point far away horizontal line. plot therefore provides intuitive complement numeric summaries shown .
code: library(lavaan) # Simulate data set.seed(1234) n <- 200 x <- runif(n) - 0.5 m <- 0.4 * x + rnorm(n) y <- 0.3 * m + rnorm(n) dat <- data.frame(x, m, y)  # Specify model model <- '   m ~ a * x   y ~ b * m + cp * x   ab := a * b '  # Fit model fit0 <- sem(model, data = dat, fixed.x = FALSE)  # Store bootstrap draws # Before calling `jab_after_boot()`, you **must** re-run the model with store_boot(keep.idx = TRUE).  This is crucial: without `keep.idx = TRUE`, the bootstrap index matrix (boot.idx) will not be saved, and JAB cannot compute leave-one-out subdistributions.  fit2 <- store_boot(   fit0,   R = 5000,   iseed = 2345,           keep.idx = TRUE            ) # Run JAB analysis for b res1 <- semboottools::jab_after_boot(   fit2,   param        = "b",          standardized = TRUE,   top_k        = 5,   plot         = TRUE,   plot_engine  = "ggplot2",   font_family  = "sans" ) #>  #> === Full-sample bootstrap summary (ALL) === #>  scope param      mean         SE     CI.Lo     CI.Up #>    ALL     b 0.3377757 0.07087301 0.1941315 0.4714736 #>  #> === Leave-one-out (LOO) summaries === #>  case JAB_value      mean         SE     CI.Lo     CI.Up #>    92 -7.265716 0.3014471 0.06691697 0.1675634 0.4262696 #>   137  4.284467 0.3591980 0.07043389 0.2110645 0.4911241 #>    81 -4.052481 0.3175133 0.06999906 0.1731859 0.4480780 #>   193  3.876416 0.3571577 0.06899989 0.2152160 0.4887382 #>   127 -3.873037 0.3184105 0.07269465 0.1762345 0.4551080 # Run JAB analysis for ab res2 <- semboottools::jab_after_boot(   fit2,   param        = "ab",          standardized = TRUE,   top_k        = 10,   plot         = TRUE ) #>  #> === Full-sample bootstrap summary (ALL) === #>  scope param       mean         SE       CI.Lo     CI.Up #>    ALL    ab 0.02248262 0.02801863 -0.03249827 0.0801279 #>  #> === Leave-one-out (LOO) summaries === #>  case  JAB_value       mean         SE       CI.Lo      CI.Up #>   137  2.0694700 0.03282997 0.02927190 -0.02581250 0.08970996 #>    78  1.7594344 0.03127979 0.02776399 -0.02456933 0.08757414 #>   123 -1.5161302 0.01490197 0.02800061 -0.04028824 0.06810769 #>    86 -1.2273696 0.01634577 0.02687397 -0.03770233 0.06672054 #>    81  1.1724804 0.02834502 0.02614015 -0.02180055 0.08551743 #>   114 -0.9656210 0.01765451 0.02747352 -0.03468617 0.07179822 #>   113 -0.9207178 0.01787903 0.02811111 -0.03733626 0.07244217 #>    23  0.9070081 0.02701766 0.02802264 -0.02655530 0.08500396 #>    71  0.9052507 0.02700887 0.02817719 -0.02667212 0.08719627 #>    95  0.8340024 0.02665263 0.02756542 -0.02685990 0.08404846

title: jab_after_boot
text: Efron, B., & Tibshirani, R. J. (1993). Introduction Bootstrap. Chapman & Hall.

title: parameterEstimates_boot
code: parameterEstimates_boot(object,                         level = .95,                         standardized = FALSE,                         boot_org_ratio = FALSE,                         boot_ci_type = c("perc", "bc", "bca.simple"),                         save_boot_est = TRUE,                         boot_pvalue = TRUE,                         boot_pvalue_min_size = 1000,                         ...)

title: parameterEstimates_boot
code: # Set seed for reproducibility set.seed(1234)  # Generate data n <- 1000 x <- runif(n) - 0.5 m <- 0.20 * x + rnorm(n) y <- 0.17 * m + rnorm(n) dat <- data.frame(x, y, m)  # Specify mediation model in lavaan syntax mod <- '   m ~ a * x   y ~ b * m + cp * x   ab := a * b   total := a * b + cp '

title: parameterEstimates_boot
code: # Ensure bootstrap estimates are stored fit <- sem(mod, data = dat, fixed.x = FALSE) fit <- store_boot(fit)  est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit) print(est_boot) #>  #> Bootstrapping: #>                                      #>  Valid Bootstrap Samples: 1000       #>  Level of Confidence:     95.0%      #>  CI Type:                 Percentile #>  P-Value:                 Asymmetric #>  #> Parameter Estimates Settings: #>                                               #>  Standard errors:                  Standard   #>  Information:                      Expected   #>  Information saturated (h1) model: Structured #>  #> Regressions: #>                Estimate    SE     p  CI.Lo CI.Up   bSE    bp bCI.Lo bCI.Up #>  m ~                                                                       #>   x (a)           0.089 0.103 0.386 -0.113 0.291 0.108 0.446 -0.121  0.287 #>  y ~                                                                       #>   m (b)           0.192 0.034 0.000  0.125 0.260 0.037 0.000  0.121  0.265 #>   x (cp)         -0.018 0.112 0.871 -0.238 0.202 0.112 0.868 -0.240  0.214 #>  #> Variances: #>                Estimate    SE     p  CI.Lo CI.Up   bSE    bp bCI.Lo bCI.Up #>   .m              0.898 0.040 0.000  0.819 0.977 0.041 0.000  0.820  0.983 #>   .y              1.065 0.048 0.000  0.972 1.159 0.045 0.000  0.973  1.151 #>    x              0.085 0.004 0.000  0.077 0.092 0.002 0.000  0.080  0.089 #>  #> Defined Parameters: #>                Estimate    SE     p  CI.Lo CI.Up   bSE    bp bCI.Lo bCI.Up #>  ab (ab)          0.017 0.020 0.392 -0.022 0.056 0.021 0.446 -0.025  0.059 #>  total (total)   -0.001 0.114 0.993 -0.224 0.222 0.115 0.994 -0.229  0.225 #>  #> Footnote: #> - SE: Original standard errors. #> - p: Original p-values. #> - CI.Lo, CI.Up: Original confidence intervals. #> - bSE: Bootstrap standard errors. #> - bCI.Lo, bCI.Up: Bootstrap confidence intervals. #> - bp: Bootstrap p-values.

title: parameterEstimates_boot
code: # Change confidence level to 99% est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit, level = 0.99) # Use bias-corrected (BC) bootstrap confidence intervals est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit, boot_ci_type = "bc") # Turn off asymmetric bootstrap p-values est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit, boot_pvalue = FALSE) # Do not save bootstrap estimates (for memory saving) est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit, save_boot_est = FALSE) # Compute and display bootstrap-to-original CI ratio est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit, boot_org_ratio = TRUE) # Combine options: BC CI, 99% level, no p-values est_boot <- parameterEstimates_boot(fit,                                     level = 0.99,                                     boot_ci_type = "bc",                                     boot_pvalue = FALSE)

title: parameterEstimates_boot
code: # Print with more decimal places (e.g., 5 digits) print(est_boot, nd = 5) # Print in lavaan-style text format (similar to summary()) print(est_boot, output = "text") # Print as a clean data frame table print(est_boot, output = "table") # Drop specific columns (e.g., "Z") in lavaan.printer format print(est_boot, drop_cols = "Z") # Combine options: 5 decimal digits, text format print(est_boot, nd = 5, output = "text")

title: semboottools
text: vignette demonstrates form bootstrapping confidence intervals examining bootstrap estimates SEM using semboottools.
code: library(semboottools) library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-19 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.

title: semboottools
text: use simple mediation model large sample (N = 1000). model includes: predictor x, mediator m, outcome y. Indirect effect (ab) total effect (total) defined.
code: # Set seed for reproducibility set.seed(1234)  # Generate data n <- 1000 x <- runif(n) - 0.5 m <- 0.20 * x + rnorm(n) y <- 0.17 * m + rnorm(n) dat <- data.frame(x, y, m)  # Specify mediation model in lavaan syntax mod <- '   m ~ a * x   y ~ b * m + cp * x   ab := a * b   total := a * b + cp '

title: semboottools

what: Form Bootstrap CIs for for Unstandardized Cofficients
title: semboottools
text: ‘parameterEstimates_boot()’ computes bootstrap CIs, standard errors, optional asymmetric p-values unstandardized parameter estimates, including free user-defined parameters. requires bootstrap estimates stored via store_boot(), supports percentile bias-corrected CIs, outputs bootstrap SEs standard deviation estimates.

title: semboottools::standardizedSolution_boot
code: # Change confidence level std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, level = 0.99) # Use bias-corrected bootstrap CIs std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, boot_ci_type = "bc") std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, boot_ci_type = "bca.simple") # Compute delta ratio std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, boot_delta_ratio = TRUE) # Do not save bootstrap estimates std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, save_boot_est_std = FALSE) # Turn off asymmetric bootstrap p-values std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit, boot_pvalue = FALSE) # Combine options std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit,                                       boot_ci_type = "bc",                                       boot_delta_ratio = TRUE)

title: semboottools::standardizedSolution_boot
code: # Print standardized solution in friendly format print(std_boot, output = "text") # Print with more decimal places (e.g., 5 decimal digits) print(std_boot, nd = 5) # Print only bootstrap confidence intervals print(std_boot, boot_ci_only = TRUE) # Print both unstandardized and standardized solution print(std_boot, standardized_only = FALSE) # Combine options: more decimals + show both solutions print(std_boot, nd = 4, standardized_only = FALSE) # Combine options: show only bootstrap CI, 5 decimal places print(std_boot, boot_ci_only = TRUE, nd = 5)

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot
text: Produce diagnostic plots bootstrap estimates using ggplot2. Compared hist_qq_boot() (base graphics), function modular modern: optional layers (histogram, mean line, CI, SD arrow, QQ), ability return data ggplot object customization.

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot
code: gg_hist_qq_boot(   object,   param,   standardized = NULL,   bins = 35,   show_ci = TRUE,   show_mean = TRUE,   show_sd_arrow = TRUE,   show_qq = TRUE,   show_hist = TRUE,   text_size = 3,   ci_label_digits = 3,   mean_label_digits = 3,   sd_label_digits = 3,   sd_clip_to_density = TRUE,   sd_arrow_height = 0.58,   trim_quantiles = NULL,   ci_line_color = "#D62728",   dens_line_color = "#8B0000CC",   bar_fill = "#5DADE233",   bar_color = "#1B4F72",   enforce_serif = TRUE,   theme_override = NULL,   dens_adjust = 1,   dens_from = NULL,   dens_to = NULL,   show_boot_mean = TRUE,   point_color = "#000000",   boot_mean_color = "#AA3377",   output = c("draw", "ggplot", "data"),   return = NULL,   ... )

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot
text: object lavaan object stored bootstrap results, sbt_std_boot (standardizedSolution_boot()) sbt_ustd_boot (parameterEstimates_boot()) object. param Character. Name parameter plot (coef() "lhs op rhs"). standardized Logical. Use standardized estimates. Ignored sbt_* inputs. bins Integer. Number histogram bins show_hist = TRUE. Default 35. show_ci Logical. Draw CI vertical dashed lines labels. Default TRUE. show_mean Logical. Draw point estimate vertical line label. Default TRUE. show_sd_arrow Logical. Draw ±SD double‐headed arrow label. Default TRUE. show_qq Logical. Add side--side QQ plot (uses patchwork available). Default TRUE. show_hist Logical. Draw histogram (otherwise density ). Default TRUE. text_size Numeric. Font size labels. Default 3. ci_label_digits, mean_label_digits, sd_label_digits Integer digits labels. Default 3. sd_clip_to_density Logical. Clip SD arrow within density curve span. Default TRUE. sd_arrow_height Numeric (0,1]. Relative height SD arrow. Default 0.58. trim_quantiles Length-2 numeric. Trim x-axis quantiles (e.g., c(.01,.99)). NULL = trimming. ci_line_color Color CI lines. Default "#D62728". dens_line_color Color density curve. Default "#8B0000CC". bar_fill, bar_color Histogram fill/border colors. Defaults "#5DADE233" / "#1B4F72". enforce_serif Logical. Use serif base family theme. Default TRUE. theme_override Optional ggplot2::theme() added top base theme. dens_adjust Numeric ≥ 0. Bandwidth adjust stats::density(). Default 1. dens_from, dens_to Optional numeric. Force /range density(). show_boot_mean Logical. Draw bootstrap mean vertical line. Default TRUE. point_color Color point estimate line. Default "#000000".      # <– 新增，名称与代码一致 boot_mean_color Color bootstrap mean line. Default "#AA3377". output One "draw", "ggplot", "data". return/draw. Default "draw". return Deprecated. Backward-compatible alias output; supplied, overrides output.  # <– 新增 ... Additional arguments passed ggplot layers (e.g., geom_histogram()).

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot
text: output = "draw": draws plot invisibly returns ggplot object; output = "ggplot": returns ggplot object (drawing); output = "data": returns list t: bootstrap draws; t0: point estimate; sd: sample standard deviation; hist: data frame histogram layer; dens: data frame density curve (x, y); ci: list lower, upper, y_lower, y_upper. output = "draw", draws plot (invisibly) returns ggplot object; output = "ggplot", returns ggplot (drawing); output = "data", returns list t, t0, sd, hist, dens, ci (class "sbt_boot_plotdata").

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot
text: free (unstandardized) parameters, bootstrap draws extracted directly lavaan object; user-defined parameters standardized solutions, store_boot() standardizedSolution_boot() must called advance; Supports objects class sbt_std_boot (standardized) sbt_ustd_boot (unstandardized). Return mode output = "draw": draw plot (default) invisibly return ggplot object; output = "ggplot": return ggplot object without drawing; output = "data": return list containing data frames histogram, density, CI positions (class "sbt_boot_plotdata"). Axis control default, x-axis small margin beyond observed range; set trim_quantiles = c(.01, .99) crop extreme tails quantiles. Optional layers show_hist, show_mean, show_ci, show_sd_arrow, show_qq.

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates (ggplot2, Modular) — gg_hist_qq_boot

title: Diagnostic Plots of Bootstrap Estimates in 'lavaan' — hist_qq_boot
code: library(lavaan) #> This is lavaan 0.6-19 #> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.  set.seed(5478374) n <- 50 x <- runif(n) - .5 m <- .40 * x + rnorm(n, 0, sqrt(1 - .40)) y <- .30 * m + rnorm(n, 0, sqrt(1 - .30)) dat <- data.frame(x = x, y = y, m = m)  mod <- " m ~ a * x y ~ b * m + x ab := a * b " fit <- sem(mod,            data = dat,            se = "bootstrap",            bootstrap = 50,            iseed = 985714)  # Can plot bootstrap estimates for # free parameters directly # Note that 'standardized' must be always be set to # either TRUE or FALSE. No default value. hist_qq_boot(fit, "a", standardized = FALSE)   # For estimates of user-defined parameters, # call store_boot() first. fit <- store_boot(fit) hist_qq_boot(fit, "ab", standardized = FALSE)   # For estimates in standardized solution, # call store_boot() first. fit <- store_boot(fit) hist_qq_boot(fit, "a", standardized = TRUE)  hist_qq_boot(fit, "ab", standardized = TRUE)   # It can also plot the estimates stored # in the output of standardizedSolution_boot(). std_boot <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit) #> Warning: The number of bootstrap samples (50) is less than 'boot_pvalue_min_size' (1000). Bootstrap p-values are not computed. hist_qq_boot(std_boot, "ab")  hist_qq_boot(fit, "ab", standardized = TRUE)     # Scatterplot matrix of bootstrap estimates for # two or more free parameters scatter_boot(fit, c("a", "b", "ab"), standardized = FALSE)   # Can include user-defined parameters in # scatterplot matrix, if their bootstrap # estimates have been stored scatter_boot(fit, c("ab", "a", "b"), standardized = FALSE)   # scatter_boot also supports the # standardized solution scatter_boot(fit, c("a", "b", "ab"), standardized = TRUE)

what: Jackknife-after-Bootstrap (JAB) influence for lavaan bootstrap results — jab_after_boot
title: Jackknife-after-Bootstrap (JAB) influence for lavaan bootstrap results — jab_after_boot
text: Compute Jackknife--Bootstrap (JAB) influence values single model parameter diagnose observation-level influence comparing full bootstrap distribution leave-one-(LOO) subdistributions obtained via boot.idx (stored store_boot(keep.idx = TRUE)). -summary (mean/SE/CI) taken directly consistently standardizedSolution_boot() (standardized case) parameterEstimates_boot() (unstandardized case). JAB influence defined \(I_j = n\{\bar\theta_{(-j)} - \bar\theta\}\), \(\bar\theta\) bootstrap mean replicates, \(\bar\theta_{(-j)}\) bootstrap mean replicates exclude observation \(j\).

title: Jackknife-after-Bootstrap (JAB) influence for lavaan bootstrap results — jab_after_boot

title: Jackknife-after-Bootstrap (JAB) influence for lavaan bootstrap results — jab_after_boot
text: fit lavaan object store_boot(keep.idx = TRUE) called. Must contain fit@external$sbt_boot_ustd (boot.idx attribute) typically sbt_boot_std. param Character(1). Target parameter. Accepts "lhs op rhs", ":=" label, free-parameter label. standardized Logical. TRUE, use standardized bootstrap; else unstandardized. top_k Integer. Number top cases (|JAB_value|) report. ci_level Numeric (0,1). Percentile CI level LOO subdistributions. min_keep Integer. Minimum number bootstrap replicates kept LOO subset; default max(30, floor(0.2 * B)). plot Logical. TRUE, draw JAB diagnostic plot. plot_engine Character. Plot engine plot = TRUE. One "ggplot2" "base".   # <– 新增 Default "ggplot2" available, otherwise "base". ylab_override Optional character. Override default y-axis label plot.        # <– 新增 verbose Logical. TRUE, print compact summaries. font_family Character. Graphics font family (e.g., "serif", "sans", "Times New Roman").

F occurrence matrix \(B \times n\). tstar Full bootstrap vector param.

code: library(lavaan) set.seed(5478374) n <- 50 x <- runif(n) - .5 m <- .40 * x + rnorm(n, 0, sqrt(1 - .40)) y <- .30 * m + rnorm(n, 0, sqrt(1 - .30)) dat <- data.frame(x = x, y = y, m = m) model <- ' m ~ a*x y ~ b*m ab := a*b '  # Should set bootstrap to at least 2000 in real studies fit <- sem(model, data = dat, fixed.x = FALSE,            se = "boot",            bootstrap = 100) summary(fit) #> lavaan 0.6-19 ended normally after 1 iteration #>  #>   Estimator                                         ML #>   Optimization method                           NLMINB #>   Number of model parameters                         5 #>  #>   Number of observations                            50 #>  #> Model Test User Model: #>                                                        #>   Test statistic                                 0.020 #>   Degrees of freedom                                 1 #>   P-value (Chi-square)                           0.887 #>  #> Parameter Estimates: #>  #>   Standard errors                            Bootstrap #>   Number of requested bootstrap draws              100 #>   Number of successful bootstrap draws             100 #>  #> Regressions: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>   m ~                                                  #>     x          (a)    0.569    0.325    1.749    0.080 #>   y ~                                                  #>     m          (b)    0.219    0.146    1.495    0.135 #>  #> Variances: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>    .m                 0.460    0.086    5.381    0.000 #>    .y                 0.570    0.110    5.178    0.000 #>     x                 0.078    0.012    6.782    0.000 #>  #> Defined Parameters: #>                    Estimate  Std.Err  z-value  P(>|z|) #>     ab                0.125    0.126    0.992    0.321 #>   std <- standardizedSolution_boot(fit) #> Warning: The number of bootstrap samples (100) is less than 'boot_pvalue_min_size' (1000). title: Compute and Store Bootstrap Estimates — store_boot
text: Shu Fai Cheung https://orcid.org/0000-0002-9871-9448. Based semhelpinghands::standardizedSolution_boot_ci(), originally proposed issue GitHub https://github.com/simsem/semTools/issues/101#issue-1021974657, inspired discussion Google group lavaan https://groups.google.com/g/lavaan/c/qQBXSz5cd0o/m/R8YT5HxNAgAJ. Unlike semhelpinghands::standardizedSolution_boot_ci(), function computes stores bootstrap estimates.
